## Validation.Validator.convalidate() method

Converts or validates from `unknown` to `<T>`<!-- -->. For objects and arrays, makes no guarantees wrt in-place validation or unrecognized properties.

**Signature:**

```typescript
convalidate(from: unknown, context?: TC): Result<T>;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  from | unknown | The <code>unknown</code> to be converted or validated. |
|  context | TC | _(Optional)_ An optional conversion context of type <code>&lt;TC&gt;</code> to be used in the operation. |

**Returns:**

[Result](./ts-utils.result.md)<!-- -->&lt;T&gt;

A [Result](./ts-utils.result.md) with a [Success](./ts-utils.success.md) and a value on success or an [Failure](./ts-utils.failure.md) with a a message on failure.
